qas.question: In what year did Malaysia receive its independence?
What language is used in Chinese primary schools in Malaysia?
What language is used in Chinese secondary schools in Malaysia?
What is the name of the post-independence government school system in Malaysia?
As a result of a compromise, about how many Chinese schools became National Type schools?
In what year did China institute English-medium schools?
How many people protested the school assimilation program in Malaysia?

plausible_answers.text: the government instructed all schools to surrender their properties and be assimilated

qas.question: What happened to schools after Chinese independence in 1957?
What type of schools would they have in China as a compromise after Chinese independence?
Who did the lands belong to in China after the school compromise?

context: After Malaysia's independence in <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>1957<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, <b7_0>the government instructed <a4_2>all<a4_2/> schools to surrender their properties and be assimilated<b7_0/> into the <a3_0><a3_2>National School<a3_2/><a3_0/> system. This caused an uproar among the Chinese and a compromise was achieved in that the schools would instead become <b8_0>"<a3_1>National Type<a3_1/>"<b8_0/> schools. Under such a system, the government is only in charge of the school curriculum and teaching personnel while the lands still belonged to <b9_0>the schools<b9_0/>. While Chinese primary schools were allowed to retain <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>Chinese<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> as the medium of instruction, Chinese secondary schools are required to change into <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>English<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>-medium schools. <b6_0>Over <a4_0><a4_1>60<b6_0/><a4_1/><a4_0/> schools converted to become National Type schools.
